entry.def: Notes: lines.
Notes: small liùgh.
Notes: fishing fly.
Notes: white-bellied whale.
Notes: razorfish.
Notes: a cut of fish.
Notes: inedible crab (green).
Notes: a translucent, soft-skinned lobster-shaped fish – possibly a young prawn (seen in pools).
Notes: buoy.
Notes: porpoise.
Notes: minnows.
Notes: fin.
Notes: skate.
Notes: shark.
Notes: gaff.
Notes: otter.
Notes: rock cod or young cod.
Notes: salmon.
Notes: buoy.
Notes: human palate.
Notes: shark – different species from cearbon [?].
Notes: small fish – often found under rocks at low tide.
Notes: bolt of door?
Notes: sea-urchin.
Notes: clam.
Notes: edible crab (brown).
Notes: -aich.
Notes: small fish – often under rocks at low tide. Edible.
Notes: frame for fishing-line (?).
Notes: fishing line.
Notes: brown trout.
Notes: capstan.
Quotation: pl. eisrean. Notes: oyster.
Notes: purl.
Notes: hook barb.
Notes: gills.
Notes: ‘of cat-fish family’.
Notes: frog.
Notes: hermit crab.
Notes: fish stomach.
Notes: liver.
Quotation: Thug mi latha dubh air ‘excerteadh’ an dé. Notes: worked very hard at it.
Quotation: Chan eil coibhneas anns na leabhraichean aige idir. Notes: not a feature of his behaviour.
Quotation: Cha do leag mi mo shùil air. Notes: not a glimpse.
Quotation: Bheirinn mo leth-dhubhag air. Notes: i.e. one of two.
Quotation: Liùg e staigh. Notes: stink [sic].
Quotation: a’ loineadh eisg. Notes: spoiling food by handling it too much; pawing anything.
Notes: dirty, messy.
(f) Notes: ann a’ fighe.
(m) Quotation: Mac-mallachd air! (drat him!) Chan d’fhuair mi am mac-mallachd (i.e. nothing).
(f) Quotation: Tha magaid ’na cheann. Notes: whims, irrational behaviour.
Quotation: sgadan malcte. Notes: just off.
Quotation: Mhealaich e. Notes: die of exposure.
Quotation: duine meuraiteach. ’S ann meuraiteach a tha e ga ithe. Notes: eating food without enthusiasm.
Quotation: Mì-shealbh ort. Notes: drat.
Quotation: Cho daor ris an aran mhilis.
Quotation: a bheag no mhór.
(f) Notes: wrasse.
(f) Quotation: Chaidh e ’na mo mhuilchinn. Notes: not munighinn.
(m) Quotation: ’na shuidhe am mullach an teine. Notes: not quite.
Quotation: fàileadh muthaich. Tha e muthaidh. Notes: musty. Used adjectively.
Quotation: A bheil esan a’ dol gu Beasa an drasda.
?? (f) Quotation: Fhuair mi rad-… bhuaithe. Notes: severe ticking off.
Quotation: Chan eil a sud ach raspars. Làn raspars. Notes: pride, showing off.
Quotation: Tha an dorus fosgailte reub a’ chraois. Notes: wide open (‘eu’ as in ‘beul’).
(m) Quotation: ’ga cuir fhein as na riochdan. Notes: wearing latest and wildest fashions.
(f) Quotation: Thainig e steach le roid. Notes: rush.
(f) Quotation: roidhl ma bheul na bà. Notes: Dwelly – ròil.
(m) Quotation: Chan eil air [duine] ach gu bheil an rong ann. Notes: spark of life?
(f) Quotation: ròp ghuidheachan.
Quotation: Téa ruadhain. An fheòil air a dhol ’na ruadhan le cus bruich.
(f) Notes: rumbling in tummy.
(m) Notes: ram.
Notes: stacking peat.
Notes: a medium size peat stack (smaller than cruach).
Quotation: Tha ’n duine ud ga mo ruighinn mar a bhios e cho bragail. Tha mi air mo ruighinn aig… Notes: anger, irritate.
Notes: rurachd, searching.
Quotation: Air do chasan ‘rùis’.
Notes: making a peat stack intermediate in size between ‘rùdhan’ and ‘cruach’.
Quotation: “Carson a rinn thu e?” “Airson sud fhein.” Notes: never mind. What’s it to you? Dismissive.
(m) Quotation: siuga seipein. Notes: mug. Not jug.
(m) Notes: a lot of… (slangy)
Quotation: ’na shuidhe am mullach an teine. Notes: not quite.
Quotation: as na riochdan. Notes: in latest and wildest fashions.
Notes: barbed wire.
Notes: seòrsa éisg. Young of ‘saoidhean’?
Quotation: air a thiur [?] fhéin.
Quotation: air an todhar. Notes: “on the bleaching green” “being bleached”.
(m) Notes: peat iron.
(f) Quotation: ìngnean cait.
(m) Quotation: isean ceàird. Isein [sic] a tha thu ann! Notes: brat.
(m) Notes: bobbin.
(m) Quotation: Bha nòisean aige do Cheit. Notes: a fancy for. (slangy)
(f) Quotation: oighreachd Amhuinnsuidhe (Harris). Notes: an estate.
(m) Quotation: Chan eil e ri fhaighinn ged a bheireadh tu ’n t-òr dearg air.
(m) Notes: claw hammer.
(f) Quotation: Bi modhail no gheibh thu pais. Notes: a slap (pat [?] to a child).
Quotation: Chaidh e ann am paisean. Notes: faint.
Quotation: ag obair aig peileir a bheatha; ag obair aig peileir dearg a bheatha. Notes: peithir?
(f) Notes: sp. pickle.
Quotation: a’ plùsgadh. Notes: squeeze, press.
(m?) Quotation: plump uisge. Notes: short, heavy shower.
(f) Notes: crumbs.
(m) Quotation: “Nach ann a sin tha ’m preasan!” Notes: present. E.g. on seeing a dog’s calling card. Usually sarcastic.
(m) Quotation: preig duine.
(f) Notes: baby prawn? (shell-less)
Quotation: putadh a’ bhuntàta. Notes: loosening soil.
Quotation: duine beag putach.
(m) Quotation: fear nam putan bhuidhe. Notes: police.
(m) Notes: dust (cloud of); also vb. throw.
Quotation: taigh na sad ort!
(m) Quotation: Tha a’ saoghal-bràgh [sic] de chofaidh am Brazil.
Notes: used of youngster who talks like an older person.
(f) Quotation: abair sèib! Notes: a slap-up meal.
(m) Quotation: seadhar gàirdeanach. [NOTES: slipped under ‘seuthar’.]
(f) Notes: loud sneezing (part. of animal).
Quotation: Chan eil sgialt aice.
(m) Notes: gay young girl.
(m) Notes: sprain.
(f) Notes: Orig. melted soap/water solution used in fulling. A mess; rubbish; used of persons, strongly pejorative.
(f) Notes: voluminous spit.
(f) Notes: a hard blow.
(m) Quotation: Thug e dha/Fhuair e sgoladh dha theangaidh. Notes: tongue lashing.
(f) Quotation: sgonn mhór nighne/lof.
(f) Notes: a scratch.
(f) Quotation: Phòs e s. de chailleach.
Quotation: Sgud e troimh a’ bhaile. Notes: to take a short cut. Eng. “scud”?
(m) Notes: left-overs (food).
(m) Quotation: “bodach an t-sìlein agus sìlean ’na bhròig, dh’fhalbh e gu taigh caillich…” (start of a trad. bedtime story). Notes: a very small potato.
(f) Quotation: a’ cuir duine dhan t-siorruidheachd.
Quotation: Gheibh thu do shlaiseadh. Notes: shank.
(f) Quotation: slaod mhór duine.
(f) Quotation: a’ cur a’ bhuntàta leis an t-slibheig. Notes: with stick (hand-drill?).
Quotation: a’ gluasad slìgeach (i.e. slaodach); duine slìgeach (sly or slow); glas, uaine slìgeach – pastel shades.
Quotation: Cha do smellig e i [?]. Notes: of a good goal [?] at football.
(m) Notes: crumbs.
Notes: to kill? Usually only in threats – spadaidh mi e ma chì mi e.
(f) Quotation: Chan eil làn spàinneach (de chiall) aige.
Quotation: nighean gu spleogaigeadh fhein airson an dannsa. Notes: applying to cosmetic arts.
(f?) Quotation: spliadhan móra chasan. Notes: spleadh – Dwelly. Splay feet.
(f) Notes: bouncing flat stones on water. Splionag [sic] is the stone or one cast (e.g. se spliongag mhath a tha sud).
(f) Notes: pl. – sprats.
Notes: kicking out flarting [?].
Quotation: Chan fhaigh thu sud ged a shracadh tu (a’ rànaich). Go sracadh (le gàireachdraich).
(f) Quotation: anns an stàlaidh. Notes: stall.
Notes: pack tight; press; forcing into…
Notes: walking [?] the floor (usually [?] with child).
(f) Notes: slap on bottom.
Quotation: a’ stéidheadh cruaich (moine).
(m) Quotation: a’ stobadh. Stob an t-ugh dhan a’ bhùin [?] as a’ spot. Stob e sud na mo laimh. Stob maide. Notes: thrust (quickly) / stob, post.
Quotation: a’ stodhadh. Notes: packing tight. [NOTES: slipped under ‘stodh’.]
Quotation: Stop e ’n toll le poll.
(f) Quotation: strap luch; strap ann an sgoil, etc.
(m) Quotation: “’N d’fhuair thu suathadh a-raoir.” Notes: a feel?
(f) Quotation: coimhead fo’n t-sùil.
Notes: supple, lithe.
(f) Quotation: only in phrase “dh’ithinn surc”.
(f) Quotation: scéile guail. Notes: 112 lbs [?]. [NOTES: slipped under ‘scèile’.]
(f) Quotation: tac fearainn. Notes: a tack, medium size farm.
(m) Notes: forward girl/woman.
(m) Notes: a strong blow or kick (at a football). (hammer?)
(m) Quotation: tamhasg duine; ’s ann a sud tha ’n tamhasg (duine). Notes: orig. – ghost. Strongly pej.
Quotation: a’ taomadh (not trans.?). Notes: digging, turning soil.
(f) Notes: expletive.
(f) Quotation: Thug mi dha sgoladh dha mo theangaidh.
(m) Quotation: a’ gabhail teas gu rud (gu obair air choireigin, gu seòrsa biadh). Notes: craze; passion for.
Quotation: A thèagharna! Notes: (expression of disgust) corruption of ‘tighearna’.
Quotation: Toirt leis a’ rathaid mhóir. Notes: staggering.
Quotation: A thiachdais! Notes: My goodness.
(m) Quotation: Bha e a’ tilgeil. Thainig an tilgeil air. Notes: vomiting.
Quotation: a’ tionndadh (intrans.?). Notes: digging over.
Quotation: air a thiuc fhein. Notes: on own initiative.
(m) Notes: tòn – slang.
Quotation: a’ tobhaigeadh. Notes: hoe (vb).
(m) Quotation: aodach a-muigh air an todhar. Notes: on bleaching green.
Quotation: Thog i bataichean. Notes: moved/flitted, bag or [?] baggage.
Quotation: a’ togail na mòna. Notes: first stage in drying process – see ‘coilleag’.
(f) Quotation: iteachan beag putach, deireadh iteachain.
(m) Quotation: tònasach grànda duine. Notes: as much a reference to character as to appearance.
Quotation: Cho tioram ris an tràthach. Notes: Hay?
(m) Quotation: Cha do dh’ith e tròcair. Notes: not a bite.
(f) Notes: foot rule. Not ‘try square’.
(f) Quotation: Thainig tuainealaich orm. Notes: dizziness, feeling faint.
Quotation: a’ tughadh cruach. Notes: thatching (with clods).
(f) Notes: very big stone, boulder.
(m) Quotation: Bi fuaim duine sgrìobadh iarann le ìngnean a’ toirt uisge glas gu/fo m’fhiaclan.
(m) Quotation: Na bodaich: “tha ’n t-abachadh anns a’ bhun (aig a’ chorca)”. Sin nuair a dh’fhaodadh a spealadh.
Quotation: Tha mi ag aognachadh roimh’n an là a-màireach. Notes: dread.
(m) Notes: gingerbread.
(m) Quotation: Cha daor ris an aran mhilis.
(f) Quotation: àrdraich a’ bhaitsealair. Notes: sp.
(m) Quotation: badan. Notes: nappies.
(m) Notes: wheelbarrow.
(m) Notes: stretcher; eileatrom.
(m) Quotation: Thog i bataichean. Notes: moved, bag and baggage, flitted.
Quotation: Gheibh mi a’ bheag no mhór air choireigin. Notes: implies ‘beag’ is more likely.
(m) Quotation: Cia mheud beathach cruidh a th’ agad?
(m) Notes: loose mouths [sic].
Quotation: Chaidh e bharr (far) na guallainn. Notes: dislocated.
Quotation: eadar dà bhì an doruis. Notes: ? peering out through half-opened door.
(f) Quotation: biast mhór de dhuine/iasg/rud.
(m) Quotation: air bhioran. Notes: on edge.
(f) Notes: sharp-tongued woman/girl. Also gen. pejorative.
(m) Notes: brat. Of adult – rude and pugnacious.
Quotation: Tha mi air blas a’ chragain a ghabhail air.
Quotation: cat a’ blasagraich mu bheul. Notes: licking his chops.
(m) Quotation: bodach eile! (tapag) bodach coin! Notes: Sometimes 1st word is 1 syll. – pres. this is the orig. form.
Quotation: Tha mi b...
Quotation: am bòidh! Notes: boy!
(m) Notes: salmon. (Harris. Also occasionally – ‘bradan’.)
Notes: used of male, means – fat, ruddy complexion, usually fair-haired.
(?) (m) Quotation: clann a’ cluich le briaghaichean. Notes: trinkets. (In the example given – usually broken pottery.)
(f) Quotation: Briogais coin! (tapag)
Notes: mumbling.
Quotation: Tha e frithealtach ’na bhuadhan. Notes: bowel movements.
(f) Quotation: anns na buillean. Notes: in death throes.
(m) Quotation: buntàta sìl. Notes: seed potatoes.
(m) Quotation: busan móra dearga. Notes: cheek (Harris). Dwelly – Uist.
Quotation: Tha na bustraichean aice. Notes: buisneachd.
(f) Quotation: Rinn e b. uabhcall [?] e. Notes: a mess.
Quotation: wèir bhiorach. Notes: barbed wire.
Quotation: Tha i (a’ mheanbh-chuileag) biorach.
(m) Quotation: cabadh a’ bhuntàta.
(f) Quotation: Bha càil a’ latha ann. (morning)
(f) Quotation: “Cailleach, a chailleach-chòsag / inns thusa dhòmhsa / ’m bi latha math a màireach ann / ’s bheir mi dhut paidhear bhrògan.” Notes: slater (woodhouse).
Quotation: té cartaidh. Notes: “stewed” tea.
Quotation: Tha a’ chlann bheag a’ caoch. Tha na h-uain a’ caoch. Notes: frolicking, gambolling, playing.
Notes: almond-eyed.
(m) Notes: thin person.
(m) Quotation: “Chì thu sin, a charaid ort.”
Quotation: a’ togail leanabh casa-còbhlagain [sic]. Notes: piggy-back.
(m) Notes: shark.
(f) Notes: kick.
(f) Notes: giggling (girls).
(m) Notes: peg.
(f) Notes: carborundum stone.
(m) Notes: bolt.
Quotation: fighe chlaiseach, dà lùb chlaiseach, trì phlèin. Notes: purl.
(f) Quotation: a’ cumail cluas ri claisneachd.
(m) Quotation: A bheil clig agad? Notes: boy/girl friend (used only to children).
Quotation: a’ cligeadh. Notes: courting. Used only in teasing kids.
(m) Notes: childish name for male reproductive organ.
(f) Quotation: a’ chlòsaid. Notes: second bedroom, usually.
(m) Notes: sea-urchin elsewhere, cnagan-faoileig, etc.
Quotation: Chaidh e a’ cnàmhan a ghabhaill.
(f) Notes: lice in hair (cnuimh).
Quotation: lomnochd ach a còta bian ’s a cnapan àrda. Notes: see also cnapan àrda.
(m) Quotation: cnaparnach mór balaich. Notes: big boy.
(m) Quotation: Bha a’ leanabh a’ rànaich gus an dàinig cnead ann. Notes: whimper?
(f) Notes: a coble (of a type introduced by Norwegian whaling company in this century).
(m) Quotation: coc feòir. Notes: not goc.
(f) Notes: first stage in peat ‘lifting’– 4 or 5 peats.
Quotation: beul coma. Notes: loose mouth.
Quotation: Có tha comhailteachadh [sic] cò’ (?) riut (?)? Notes: attendant at wedding – male or female.
(f) Notes: comhachag. Large white shell (conch).
(f) Quotation: corc fheòir – hay fork. Corc – butcher’s knife.
(f) Notes: a woman who is always busy, or always alert and on the move. A bird name orig.?
(m) Notes: goose pimples.
(m) Quotation: Fhuair mi mo chrann-todhair bhuaipe. Notes: to get “blazes” (same slang status and intensity).
(m) Quotation: dorus fosgailte reub a chraois. Notes: wide open.
(m) Quotation: criobhall duine.
(f) Quotation: duine ’s croit air. Notes: hump, hunchback.
Notes: hoe.
(f) Notes: large clumsy person (usually [?] woman).
(f) Notes: anchor.
Notes: a row, in knitting.
(f) Quotation: Thainig cuairt orm. Notes: feeling faint.
Quotation: Tha sinn cuibhteas iad a nis. Notes: rid of (quit).
Quotation: Tha iad ’gus cuibteachadh [sic]. Notes: quit.
Quotation: Gheibh thu c. Notes: i.e. fist.
Quotation: Tha na Bliadhna Uir anns a’ Chunntas Ur.
Quotation: Daingead ort.
Notes: stubborn.
Quotation: Aig peileir dearg a bheatha.
(f) Quotation: Tha ’n deàrrsach ann an dràsda. (uisge) Notes: very heavy rain.
Notes: spider crab??
(f) Quotation: dileag pharaffin.
Quotation: a’ ditheadh. Notes: press.
(m) Quotation: “Dìodaman, dòdaman, cota beag dubh, trì chasan iarainn (?) is ceann beag fiodh.” Notes: top.
(f) Notes: fish.
Notes: surly.
(f) Notes: surly girl/woman.
Quotation: a’ dreannadh fhiaclan. Notes: gnashing.
(f) Quotation: “Bheir mise air an dreannaig agad!” Notes: back.
(m) Notes: querulous person, surly.
Quotation: Dhrùidh orm. Notes: I was soaked to the skin. Note usage.
(m) Quotation: Tha esan air an aon duan. Notes: on his hobby-horse.
Quotation: Bha trod an duine dhuibh a sud a-raoir. Notes: i.e. very serious.
Quotation: feòil dhubh. Notes: lean.
(m) Notes: brown trout.
(m) Quotation: dul no [na?] spaide.
Quotation: Dhunc a’ sgarbh. Notes: to submerge, dunk (trans.).
(m) Quotation: an dusd. Notes: corpse. [?]
(m) Quotation: ag eacarsaich; dé an eacarsaich a th’ort a sin. Notes: not e.g. [?] – exercise. Bounding about; antics, i.e. frivolous quality.
Quotation: Chan eagalt dhut.
Notes: magnificent. Of man – well-built, usually ruddy features, healthy and strong. Sometimes suitor of girls.
(f) Quotation: Chuir e an eiteig ann leis na thug e dha de shlaicean. An eiteag ann an cearc.
(m) Notes: a brat; of older person – someone always teasing people, playing practical jokes, etc.; ‘life and soul…’
Notes: aloof.
(f) Quotation: “Nach ann ormsa tha ’n fhàgail.” Notes: failing (usually of memory).
(f) Quotation: Thug mi faids dhan a’ leabhar gu ceann thall a’ ruim [?]. Thoir dha faids. Notes: a fling, throw, push or blow.
(f) Notes: untidy housewife.
Quotation: a’ feannadh poll mònadh.
(f) Quotation: Tha na fiaclan air deanabh [?].
Quotation: a’ fiachainn gu Ceit.
Quotation: Tha fiarshùilich ann. Notes: squint.
(f) Notes: sleet.
Quotation: Tha i air flot. Notes: of boat – buoy out [?].
(f) Notes: wart.
(f) Quotation: fras fheòir. Notes: seed.
Notes: having stutter.
(f) Quotation: bùntàta ag gàireachdraich. Notes: sp.
(f) Notes: bite.
(m) Quotation: gàrradh (fhàd). Notes: a wall of drying peats.
Quotation: a’ geadadh leanabh. Notes: being rough to.
Quotation: Feòil gheal (by contrast with feòil dhubh).
Quotation: Chan eil a shamhail a-measg nan daoine geala.
(m) Notes: pejorative – implies impotence of one kind or another.
(m) Notes: hermit crab.
Notes: rattling.
Quotation: a’ glamhadh do bhiadh. Notes: voracious eating.
Quotation: a’ glanadh a’ bhuntata. Notes: weeding.
Notes: See uisge glas.
(m) Notes: big clumsy boy.
(m) Quotation: Tha ’n t-uaireadair agam (no inneal sam bith) air a dhol ’na ghleoc. Notes: has broken down (implies permanently).
(m) Notes: long clumsy person.
(m) Notes: tinny noise.
(m) Quotation: Chan eil an glóran air fhàghail agam de mo chuid airgeid. Notes: cluaran?
Notes: erotic; of person – sexy. (slang)
(m) Quotation: Cha deach gnogadh air D. o bha e sia bliadhna.
Notes: sharp-featured; snotty.
(f) Notes: of woman, shrew-featured, sharp-tongued and nosey, or gen. pejorative.
(f) Notes: fool. Esp. “a ghoraisg”.
(m) Quotation: an greim mór. Notes: appendicitis.
Quotation: a’ griosad. Notes: cursing [?]. More old-fashioned than “guidhe” – poss. intenser.
Notes: to touch bottom.
Quotation: a’ fiachainn gu Ceit [?].
(m) Notes: phosphate fertiliser.
(m) Quotation: Thug e dhomh ‘hunt’. Notes: hint, subtle reminder of e.g. a debt, or one’s disgrace, etc.
Quotation: Tha an taigh ’na thùp-thàp. Notes: in disarray, untidy, topsy-turvy.

div.head: D. MacLeod, Ardhasaig, N. Harris. Date: 1967.

entry.def: Notes: cockle.
Notes: shellfish of some kind.
Notes: clams.

div.head: D. J. MacLeod, Ardhasaig, Harris. Date: 1978.

entry.def: Notes: want, or piece short, used in weaving context. Has been used of a precentor who used C/M tune for L/M Psalm. Dol an inneamh: be obliged to (Harris).
Notes: very strong tea.
Quotation: pl. -an. Notes: sock – half-calf length – knitted for sale. ?Eng. gum-sock.
Notes: (? or singealachadh) Putting potatoes and manure in the drill when planting.
Notes: ‘slow; impunctual’. Of colours: ‘slìgeach liath’ = pastel shade of blue.
Notes: (central vowel in 1st syll.) Marking of the ground prior to digging or cutting peats.
Notes: of colours: ‘mousey’ or in combinations, e.g. cabhach liath ‘a dirty blue (or grey)’.
Notes: an excessive handling, esp. of fish.
Quotation: pl. sgùileachan. Notes: ‘net’ made from hide.
Quotation: “Fhreumhaich no eamaid cha téid mu do chasan gus an téid thu do’n ghreusaiche leis an t-seice ud” – cailleach ri a fear.

div.head: Mrs Jessie MacLeod, Ardhasaig, Harris. Date: 1967.

entry.def: Quotation: cadalain-thràghad. Notes: sand-fleas.
Quotation: cadalain-thràghad. Notes: sand-fleas.
Notes: “seòrsa de phortan … ach tha cumadh neònach air.”
Notes: starfish.
Notes: of crùbag family – diff. in appearance; large stomach – poach (sporan) with roe; very edible.
